content.question: If the production of a good generates a positive externality, the government can increase allocative efficiency by

choices.label: taxing the producer of the good
subsidizing the producer of the good
prosecuting firms that produce the good without proper permits
setting a price ceiling to encourage production of the good
setting a price floor to discourage production of the good

content.answer: subsidizing the producer of the good

unit.text: 6: Market Failure and the Role of Government

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
